p: Pig nasal swabs were tested for influenza A virus by RT-PCR using the CDC protocol for influenza A virus detection [ 12]. The Influenza A sub-typing utilized oligonucleotides targeting hemagglutinin and neuraminidase genes (contemporary human pandemic H1, human AH3, AH7, AH5, N1 and N2) of swine influenza viruses [ 13].
